Name: Coptic textile
Description: A strip of natural linen with an embroidered pattern. The motif is geometric lozenge patterns darned in natural silk and coloured wools of green, pink, blue and rose. In the corner of the square are two round medallions with lotus flowers woven in pink with a blue centre on a red background.Technique: plain weave ground, patterns inlaid under one, two and four picks of ground weave between each inlaid thread. Tapestry weave over single warp threads. Bands of thick weft, fringed with selvedge.Ends per inch (warp threads): 28.Picks per inch (weft threads): 40 approx, all variable because of loose, uneven weave.
